articles.title: Scientists find exercise rivals therapy for depression
articles.description: A large review of studies suggests that exercise can ease depression about as effectively as psychological therapy. articles.title: This brain trick makes exercise feel easier
articles.description: Exercise doesn’t just challenge the body; it challenges how the brain interprets effort. Scientists discovered that vibrating tendons before cycling allowed people to push harder without feeling like they were working more.
